Sean Hannity: s statement on his radio show: The expert confirms that Sean Hannity did indeed tell his radio audience that Beto O'Rourke asked for help getting undocumented immigrants to vote.
O: Rourke's denial: The expert clarifies that while Hannity's statement is true, it is not true that O'Rourke is actually asking for that help. O'Rourke's campaign denies any involvement in the text message mentioned by Hannity.
Confirmation of the text message: Hannity mentions that the text message was sent out and refers to an article in the Austin American-Statesman as evidence. The expert verifies that the text message did exist and was reported by the newspaper.
Impostor claim: The expert points out that O'Rourke's campaign stated that the text message was sent by an impostor and not by O'Rourke or his team, as reported by the Austin American-Statesman. This raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim made by Hannity.
